author: Jared Nicoll
title: One of world's smallest theatres to debut at Kapiti festival
text:
One of world's smallest theatres to debut at Kapiti festival JARED NICOLL Last updated 20:52, February 22 2017 Cameron Burnell/Fairfax NZ 
Coastella organisers Paul Brown and Gerry Paul are the brains behind possibly the world's smallest theatre, Tiny Town. 
Wellington music festival-goers will get up close and personal with performers inside one of the world's smallest theatres. 
Coastella organisers Paul Brown and Gerry Paul will debut Tiny Town, a 10-foot shipping container dressed up with a stage and seating for four or five, at the one-day festival on the Kapiti Coast on February 25. 
Gerry Paul said headliners such as platinum-selling Irish star Mundy would perform inside it, with each tiny crowd sitting in for one song. Cameron Burnell/Fairfax NZ 
Coastella organisers Gerry Paul and Paul Brown will debut their Tiny Town theater at the 2017 music festival. 
Irish musician Mundy performs his hit July inside Tiny Town. Filmed here on a 360-degree camera, click and drag on the video to adjust your view. 
The inspiration came from when Paul and Brown were in a band touring the world, where some of the highlights included playing to small audiences. CAMERON BURNELL/FAIRFAX NZ. 
Tiny Town - The World's Smallest Theatre

"Often it was gigs that only four or five people were at that were the most memorable of the tour, and we'd go away thinking God that was an awesome gig. There was a chance almost to really get to know the audience. 
"The crowd's nearly on top of you on the stage and there's this kind of real intimacy and this connection that happens. 
"So we said why don't we try and build a tiny music venue so people can experience that." 
There was nowhere for performers to hide on a stage measuring just 80 centimetres deep by two metres wide in front of an audience area spanning all of four square metres. 
The setup comes complete with red velvet curtains, sound system, and a bouncer. 
The outside was painted by Wellington Street Artist Sean Duffell. 
Tiny Town, likely to be accompanied by a queue, will be one of five stages featuring at the festival. 
It will be just one of the many surreal experiences Mundy's had in his 20-year music career, which included touring with the likes of Neil Young and Alanis Morissette. 
Fresh from creating his self-titled, sixth studio album, Mundy, real name Edmond Enright, is taking his folk-rock tunes to nine centres on a national tour of New Zealand this month. - Stuff
